Submodules¶

Every view module has a response function that takes a request and returns response information.

some.mod.idc.foo(x)¶
some.mod.idc.foo(y, z)

return a bitch

views.home module¶

bulbs.views.home.categories(cursor)¶
bulbs.views.home.response(request)¶
bulbs.views.home.subcategories(cursor, category_id=None)¶

views.login module¶

bulbs.views.login.response(request)¶

views.logout module¶

bulbs.views.logout.response(request)¶

views.post_edit module¶

bulbs.views.post_edit.response(request)¶

views.post_reply module¶

bulbs.views.post_reply.response(request)¶

This view is called when someone is replying to a post

views.post_topic module¶

bulbs.views.post_topic.response(request)¶

User gets this view when he goes to create a new topic

views.register module¶

bulbs.views.register.response(request)¶

This view is called when someone is signing up

bulbs.views.register.username_taken(cursor, username)¶

views.subcategory module¶

bulbs.views.subcategory.response(request)¶

This takes a subcategory slug and returns all of its threads, replies and views

bulbs.views.subcategory.topics(cursor, subcategory_id, page)¶

views.topic module¶

bulbs.views.topic.response(request)¶

This view function is called when a thread is opened and returns the posts

bulbs.views.topic.topic_content(cursor, thread_id, page)¶

views.user module¶

bulbs.views.user.response(request)¶

views.usercp module¶

bulbs.views.usercp.response(request)¶
